snippet: With losses at the Federal Housing Administration expected to swamp revenue, officials said they would adopt measures to avoid tapping taxpayer funds.
abstract: Federal Housing Administration says it is taking steps to shore up its books and avoid taxpayer bailout; independent audit projects agency's expected losses will swamp its anticipated revenue, with a shortfall amounting to about $16.3 billion in its portfolio of insured home mortgages.
lead_paragraph: With losses at the Federal Housing Administration expected to swamp revenue, officials said they would adopt measures to avoid tapping taxpayer funds.

headline.main: F.H.A. Hopes to Avoid a Bailout by Treasury
headline.print_headline: F.H.A. Hopes to Avoid a Bailout by Treasury
